fields.ingredients:
1 pound chopped nuts

1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

1 (16 ounce) package phyllo dough

1 cup butter, melted

1 cup white sugar

1 cup water

½ cup honey

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

1 teaspoon grated lemon zest
fields.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Toss together nuts and cinnamon. Unroll phyllo and cut the whole stack in half to fit the dish. Cover phyllo with a damp cloth while assembling the baklava, to keep it from drying out.

Place 2 sheets of phyllo in the bottom of the prepared dish. Brush generously with some of the melted butter. Sprinkle 2 to 3 tablespoons of the nut mixture on top. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with about 6 sheets of phyllo.

Using a sharp knife, cut baklava into 4 long rows, then diagonally 9 times to make 36 diamond shapes. Be sure to cut all the way through to the bottom of the layers.

Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and crisp, about 50 minutes.

While baklava is baking, combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Stir in honey, vanilla, and lemon zest; reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.

Remove baklava from the oven and immediately spoon syrup over it. Let cool completely before serving. Store uncovered.

fields.ingredients:
1 head romaine lettuce- rinsed, dried and chopped
1 cucumber, sliced
2 large tomatoes, chopped
1 (6 ounce) can pitted black olives
1 green bell pepper, chopped
1 red bell pepper, chopped
1 red onion, thinly sliced
1 cup crumbled feta cheese
6 tablespoons olive oil
1 lemon, juiced
1 teaspoon dried oregano
ground black pepper to taste
fields.instructions:
1.Combine romaine, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, bell peppers, and red onion in a large bowl; sprinkle with feta cheese.
2.Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and black pepper together in a small bowl. 3.Pour dressing over salad, toss well to combine, and serve.

fields.recipe_name: Mediterranean Baked Cod with Lemon and Capers
fields.ingredients:
4 cod fillets
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 lemon, sliced
2 tablespoons capers
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 teaspoon dried thyme
Salt and pepper, to taste
fields.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place cod fillets in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle minced garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper over the fillets.
Arrange lemon slices on top of the fillets and scatter capers around them.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cod is flaky and cooked through.
Serve hot, spooning the lemony, caper-infused sauce over the fish

fields.ingredients:
• 4 cups watermelon, cubed (seedless preferred)
  • 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
  • 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, torn
  • 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze (optional)
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt (or to taste)
  • 1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper
fields.instructions:
This is where the magic happens! Let’s assemble this gorgeous salad step by step.

  1. Begin by slicing the watermelon into bite-sized cubes and place them in a large serving bowl.
  2. Crumble the feta cheese directly over the watermelon cubes.
  3. Tear the fresh mint leaves gently with your hands to preserve their oils and sprinkle them over the salad.
  4. Drizzle the olive oil evenly across the salad for a light, flavorful coating.
  5. Squeeze the lime juice over the top for a zesty kick.
  6. Optionally, drizzle balsamic glaze for a touch of sweetness.
  7. Sprinkle salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste.
  8. Gently toss the salad to combine all ingredients without breaking the watermelon. Chill for 5-10 minutes in the refrigerator if desired, then serve immediately.

fields.recipe_name: Caprese Skewers with a Balsamic Reduction
fields.ingredients:
Cherry tomatoes - about 24, washed
Mozzarella balls (bocconcini) - about 24, drained if stored in water
Fresh basil leaves - about 24 large leaves
Balsamic vinegar - 1 cup (for reduction)
Extra virgin olive oil - for drizzling (optional)
Salt - to taste
Black pepper - freshly ground, to taste
Small wooden skewers - about 12
fields.instructions:
Prepare Balsamic Reduction:
Pour 1 cup of balsamic vinegar into a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat.
Allow the vinegar to simmer gently until it reduces by about half and thickens to a syrup-like consistency, which typically takes about 10-15 minutes. Keep an eye on it to ensure it doesn’t burn.
Remove from heat and let it cool. It will continue to thicken as it cools.
Assemble the Skewers:
Start by threading one cherry tomato onto a skewer.
Next, fold a basil leaf in half (if large) and thread it onto the skewer just behind the tomato.
Then add a mozzarella ball.
Repeat the process until the skewer is filled. Typically, each skewer will have about 2 sets of tomato, basil, and mozzarella.
Repeat with the remaining skewers.
Season and Serve:
Lay the completed skewers on a serving platter.
Drizzle them with the cooled balsamic reduction and a little extra virgin olive oil if using.
Season lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Serve immediately or at room temperature.

fields.recipe_name: Greek Lemon Olive Oil Cake: A Mediterranean Delight
fields.ingredients:
• 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour (or substitute with a gluten-free blend)
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 3 large eggs
  • 3/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
  • 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (or substitute with sour cream)
  • Zest of 2 lemons
  • 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • Powdered sugar (for dusting)
  • Optional garnish: whipped cream, fresh berries, or lemon slices

Alternative Ingredients:

  • For a dairy-free version, use a plant-based yogurt instead of Greek yogurt.
  • To make it gluten-free, substitute the flour with a 1:1 gluten-free flour blend.
  • If you prefer, swap the lemon for orange for a delicious variation of this cake.
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch round cake pan or springform pan with olive oil. Line the bottom with parchment paper for easy removal.
  2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
  3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
  4. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil while continuing to mix, ensuring the mixture remains smooth and emulsified.
  5. Stir in the Greek yogurt, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla extract until well combined.
  6. Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture, stirring just until combined (be careful not to overmix).
  7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
  8. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
  9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
  10. Once cooled, dust the cake with powdered sugar and garnish with fresh berries, whipped cream, or lemon slices if desired.

This cake is best served at room temperature and pairs beautifully with a cup of coffee or tea. It’s light, flavorful, and sure to impress!

fields.ingredients:
1 1/4 cups almond flour (or whole wheat flour for a heartier texture)
1/3 cup coconut sugar (or maple syrup)
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
Pinch of salt
1/4 cup plain Greek yogurt (or plant-based yogurt for a vegan optional)
1/4 cup melted coconut oil (or unsalted butter)
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 cup dark chocolate chips (or chopped nuts, optional)
fields.instructions:
These healthier Crumble cookies are easy to make and come out soft, thick, and delicious every time. Here’s how to whip them up:

Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the almond flour, coconut sugar, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, mix the melted coconut oil, Greek yogurt, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the dark chocolate chips or nuts, if using.
Scoop about 2 tablespoons of dough for each cookie and roll into balls.
Place the dough balls on the baking sheet and press them down slightly to form thick discs.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden. The centers should still be soft.
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5-10 minutes to firm up before transferring them to a wire rack.
These cookies are soft, chewy, and full of flavor. Serve them warm for a gooey, indulgent treat!

fields.ingredients:
2 sub rolls or hoagie rolls, preferably toasted
4 slices Genoa salami
4 slices pepperoni
4 slices capicola ham
4 slices provolone cheese
1/4 cup shredded lettuce
1/4 cup sliced tomatoes
1/4 cup sliced red onions
8 slices banana peppers or pepperoncini
1/4 cup black olives, sliced
2 tablespoons Italian dressing (or olive oil and red wine vinegar)
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Salt and black pepper to taste
Optional Ingredients:

Sliced pickles for extra tanginess
Jalapeños for added heat
Roasted red peppers for a smoky flavor
Fresh basil leaves for an herby touch
fields.instructions:
Preheat your oven or toaster oven to 350°F (175°C).
Slice the sub rolls in half lengthwise and place them on a baking sheet.
Layer the Genoa salami, pepperoni, and capicola ham on the bottom half of each roll.
Place two slices of provolone cheese on top of the meats.
Toast the subs in the oven for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the bread is slightly crispy.
While the subs are toasting, prepare the toppings—shred the lettuce, slice the tomatoes, onions, and banana peppers.
Once the subs are toasted, remove them from the oven.
Layer the shredded lettuce, sliced tomatoes, red onions, banana peppers, and black olives on top of the melted cheese.
Drizzle Italian dressing over the toppings, then sprinkle with oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Close the sub rolls, pressing down gently to hold everything together.
Slice the subs in half and serve immediately.
Note: If you’re short on time, you can skip the toasting step and assemble the sub cold. It’s just as delicious!

fields.ingredients:
• 2 medium ripe bananas, divided
  • 2 cups old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 3/4 cups whole milk
  • 3/4 cup banana-and-cream strained (Greek-style) yogurt or whole vanilla strained yogurt, divided
  • 2 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon chia seeds
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 graham cracker sheets, crushed (about 1/3 cup)
fields.instructions:
• Mash 1 banana in a medium bowl with a fork until no large lumps remain. Add oats, milk, ¼ cup yogurt, vanilla, chia seeds, cinnamon and salt; whisk until thoroughly combined, about 30 seconds.
  • Cover and refrigerate until the oats have absorbed the liquid and the mixture is thickened, at least 8 hours. Spoon about 1/3 cup of the oat mixture into each of 4 (8-ounce) jars; top each with 2 tablespoons of the remaining yogurt. Cut the remaining banana into ½-inch-thick slices; divide among the jars, arranging in an even layer over the yogurt. Top with the remaining oat mixture. Top with crushed graham crackers before serving.

fields.ingredients:
• 200 g gluten-free self-raising flour
  • 1.5 tsp gluten-free baking powder
  • 1 tbsp sugar
  • 300 ml milk 
  • 2 large eggs
  • vegetable oil
fields.instructions:
• Put your gluten free self-raising flour, gluten free baking powder adnd sugar into a large mixing bowl and mix together.
  • In a jug or smaller mixing bowl, add your eggs and milk and beat thoroughly.
  • Create a well in your flour bowl and add in your wet ingredients. Whisk until smooth and consistent.
  • Set your hob to a low-medium heat. Brush the pan with a light coating of oil and allow to heat - test if it's ready by spooning in one small drip of pancake batter; if it sizzles slightly, then it's ready.
  • Ladle in your pancake batter. I used a 1/4 measuring cup to do this as it's the perfect amount of batter for 1 pancake and ensures they all come out the exact same size.
  • Allow to cook until the side facing up looks like you could flip it without it splattering everywhere! This should take about 1-2 minutes at a low heat. If it's browning on the underside before the top is looking ready to flip, then lower your heat.
  • Flip it over and cook for a further 30 seconds or so and transfer to a small plate. Repeat until all the batter is used, brushing the pan with oil in between each pancake.
  • Serve up with maple syrup and bacon, Nutella, fresh berries or drizzle with your favourite dessert sauces. Enjoy!

fields.ingredients:
• All Purpose Flour– 2 cups
  • Baking Powder– 1 teaspoon
  • Salt– 1 teaspoon
  • Sugar– 1 ½ cups
  • Vegan Unsweetened Cocoa Powder– ¾ cup
  • Water- 1 cup
  • Applesauce- 1 cup unsweetened
  • Oil- ¼ cup 
  • Vanilla Extract– 1 teaspoon
  • Chocolate Chips- 1 cup
fields.instructions:
Preheat your oven to 350 and prep an baking dish (9 X 13 works well) for nonstick.

In a medium mixing bowl whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.

Next, in another medium mixing bowl, whisk or use a fork to mix together the sugar (or alternative) and the unsweetened cocoa.

Now, in a large mixing bowl, mix together the water, applesauce and oil. Then add to the large mixing bowl the flour mixture from the first bowl, stirring gently and then adding the cocoa and sugar mixture from the second bowl.

Add the vanilla extract and mix until blended. For adding the chocolate chips, there are two options . You can fold them into the batter or add half of the batter to the prepped baking dish, add the chocolate chips, and then add the remaining batter to the baking dish.

The first option will evenly distribute the chips and the second will distribute the chips to the center of the brownies.

Bake for 26-30 minutes and allow to cool a bit before serving. A toothpick test will most likely not work in this recipe as the chocolate chips may thus give a false negative.

fields.recipe_name: Irresistible Butternut and Sweet Potato Soup
fields.ingredients:
medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed

2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed

1 medium onion, chopped

3 cloves garlic, minced

1 tablespoon olive oil (or butter for a richer flavor)

4 cups vegetable stock (chicken stock also works)

1 cup coconut milk or heavy cream

1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

½ teaspoon ground nutmeg

Salt and pepper to taste

teaspoon smoked paprika for a smoky kick

 ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper for heat

 Fresh herbs like thyme or rosemary
fields.instructions:
1.Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2.Toss the cubed butternut squash and sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them evenly on the baking sheet.
3.Roast for 25–30 minutes, flipping halfway, until the vegetables are golden and tender.
4.In a large pot, sauté the onion in olive oil over medium heat until translucent, about 5 minutes.
6.Add minced garlic, cinnamon, nutmeg, and any optional spices, stirring for 1 minute until fragrant.
7.Transfer the roasted vegetables to the pot and stir to combine with the onion mixture.
8.Pour in the vegetable stock, ensuring all ingredients are submerged. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to a simmer for 10 minutes.
9.Remove from heat and use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. (Alternatively, blend in batches in a countertop blender.) Stir in coconut milk or cream, adjusting seasoning with more salt, pepper, or spices as needed. Serve hot, garnished with a drizzle of coconut milk, fresh herbs, or toasted seeds.

fields.review: Madre mia , it is so refreshing
Loved it , but need a bit more seasoning
Chewy gooey cookies one of my favorite
